18adfe61-e46e-4332-ae23-ba6cc99388d0.description: The earner of this badge is a future advanced degree candidate (e.g. MD, PhD, or MD/PhD) who has completed the year-long Yale Program to Advance Training in Health and Sciences (PATHS) Initiative. This PATHS Scholar has increased and reinforced their commitment to pursue a meaningful career in the health and sciences by participating in diversity and inclusion seminars, learning about academic and career development, and connecting with a diverse network of mentors and peers.
18adfe61-e46e-4332-ae23-ba6cc99388d0.name: Yale University Program to Advance Training in Health and Sciences, 2021 Scholar

badge_template_activities.title: Attended and participated in the majority of the sessions and trainings with peers and instructors. This certifies that the PATH Scholar fulfilled the attendance requirements.

Participated in several workshops to learn how to assemble a competitive application package for their future advanced degree programs. Scholars received expert feedback from: current advanced degree (AD) candidates, faculty and physicians, and members of AD admission committees.

Learned about the practice of “mentoring up” and how to effectively apply this in their future advanced degree program. Students gained an understanding of their role in the mentorship process and how to establish a common set of goals/expectations in the mentor/mentee relationship.

Performed comprehensive assessments of their ‘community of support’ and identified areas for improvement. Students learned how to build and manage a personal and professional network and how to leverage their network to advance their career dreams.
Learned about the challenges that disproportionately affect students from minoritized groups in advanced degree programs and how to process, mitigate, and respond to these challenges.
Learned about different career opportunities from experts and leaders in the healthcare field and sciences.

skills.name: Advanced Degree Application Development And Knowledge Of The Interview Process

68c1b425-e9e0-494a-b820-b9c7ba8131db.description: The earner of this badge has completed the year-long Yale Program to Advance Training in Health and Sciences (PATHS). PATHS is a competitive program that exposes students from underserved and underrepresented backgrounds from across the US to expert-led workshops, panels, group conversations, and mentoring to help prepare them for advanced degrees and careers in health or science. Earners of this badge have completed a minimum of 13.5 hrs of online or in-person training from 08/21 to 06/22.

192c5440-1947-482e-8a8d-b19195c4d08c.description: The earner of this badge is a doctoral student with interest in biomedical or behavioral research who has completed the year-long Yale Ciencia Academy (YCA) program. This individual has advanced their career goals by participating in professional development training and by connecting with a diverse network of mentors and peers. The earner is empowered to impact their communities through science outreach.
192c5440-1947-482e-8a8d-b19195c4d08c.name: Yale Ciencia Academy 2020 Fellow

badge_template_activities.title: Participate in at least 6 of 8 online Conversations with Scientists, which are online video chats with role models and mentors who are in academic and non-academic careers.
Participate in at least 4 of 5 online Peer Mentoring Chats, which are online video discussions among YCA fellows to facilitate networking, peer mentoring, and community building.

Participate in at least 2 of 3 online Workshops for skills development, which are professional development workshops on the topics of mentoring, scientific teaching, and creating an Individual Development Plan (IDP). Fellows also receive two individualized advice sessions to make their IDP more actionable and move their career goals and objectives forward.

Attend the annual YCA in-person meeting, held at held at the Association for the Advancement of Science (AAAS) Annual Meeting. During the annual meeting, fellows participate in workshops on effective communication and networking.

Complete a science outreach activity. Fellows have the opportunity to impact their community through science outreach activities such as the publication of science articles or podcasts and visits to local schools.

Serve as a facilitating discussant for one online session, responsible for ensuring that active and productive discussion occurs during the online conversation. Working with two or three other fellows, gather and disseminate relevant online resources and questions to the group before the session; lead the session conversation, ensuring there is active conversation among all participants.

badge_template_activities.title: Planning - Learn planning skills and develop an actionable agenda for the post-PhD transition. Activities include: (a) Postdoc transition video modules and conversations to explore whether or not to do a postdoc and explain the postdoc search process. (b) Training and feedback to develop an Individual Development Plan (IDP) for the post-PhD transition. (c) Peer mentoring and 1:1 sessions with YCA staff to receive feedback on IDP.

Communication - Develop your ability to communicate your research and who you are as a scientist. Activities include: (a) Developing your personal narrative workshop; (b) Public engagement with science workshop; (c) Guided peer feedback on a short scientific talk after completing iBiology’s “Share Your Research” course.

Mentoring - Purposefully manage and establish mentoring relationships to ensure a successful post-PhD transition. Activities include: (a) Mentoring-Up Workshop: learn to have productive and proactive interactions with your current and future mentors. (b) Finishing your PhD: listen to current postdocs explain their experience in the final stages of their PhD. (c) Postdoc Mentoring: Discuss with postdocs and faculty how to establish productive, supportive and enriching mentoring relationships.

Annual Meetings - Attend 2 annual meetings at Yale University. During the opening meeting, fellows participate in community-building exercises, the personal narrative workshop, and group peer-mentoring with the previous YCA class. During the closing meeting, fellows participate in Mental Health discussions, individualized 1:1 sessions to advance their specific career goals, negotiation training, & peer-mentoring with the incoming YCA class. Meetings with Yale faculty and postdocs can be set up.
Outreach project - Receive counsel on how to undertake a science outreach activity that is meaningful to you, and receive feedback on your ideas during one of our Peer Mentoring sessions.

f8dc2f48-ea98-4280-947c-d61042d73aa3.description: Advisor Academy (YCA-AA), is an optional training program for the research advisors or mentors of biomedical and health sciences PhD students participating in the Yale Ciencia Academy (YCA). The YCA-AA has been designed to help advisors and mentors better support and mentor YCA fellows (and other students from minoritized backgrounds) through their PhD completion and professional development and to become advocates for inclusion in their departments.
f8dc2f48-ea98-4280-947c-d61042d73aa3.name: Yale Ciencia Academy - Advisor Academy

badge_template_activities.title: Orientation Session | Advisors came together to meet their colleagues, discuss learning objectives, and set intentional goals.

“Planning and Advising for Productivity” | Advisors received practical strategies for how to leverage the Individual Development Plan (IDP) to help their YCA Fellow reach career or research milestones and how to improve the productivity of their labs. Advisors learned about the underlying factors that disproportionately affect students from underrepresented groups and how they can provide meaningful support.

“Diversity, Equity and Inclusion Immersive” | Advisors participated in an engaging immersive experience featuring the testimonies of minoritized trainees. Through their stories, they explore the challenges many underrepresented students face in their training environments (e.g., isolation, imposter syndrome, the “minority tax,” etc.) and how they can promote cultural sensitivity and inclusion by leveraging their spheres of influence and the power of leading through empathy.
Participated in at least 3 of the 4 training sessions.
